name_location: IPE Group Dhaka, Dhaka, Bangladesh On-site
job_description: hh

Optimizely is known for content, commerce, and optimization with our Digital Experience Platform (DXP). Millions of experiences are served with our platform every single day, helping organizations grow exponentially online. We have the honor of serving some incredible customers – which makes what we do extremely rewarding. Optimizely has over 9,000 brands, from global organizations such as Visa, Sky, Yamaha, and Wall Street Journal to tech innovators like Atlassian, DocuSign, FitBit, and Zillow.

Not only are we financially sound and growing, but we have unicorn status: we exceeded $300M in revenue in 2020, is profitable already, and have all strategic options ahead of us. Optimizely continues to invest and addresses a market opportunity north of $30 billion, providing significant personal career growth opportunities.

We are an inclusive culture with a global team of 1200+ people across the US, Europe, Australia, Bangladesh, UAE, Singapore, and Vietnam. We blend European and American business cultures, emphasizing teamwork, inclusion, and moving fast. People make the difference!

If you are looking to work on the next generation of digital technologies in a fast-paced, hyper-growth environment with the best humans, please apply! We’re just getting started...

Introduction

The Expert Services team consults with customers and partners on best practices, with regard to implementations of our commerce, content management, and digital marketing solutions. We have multiple teams working for our international clients, handling projects based on Microsoft technologies, such as ASP.NET. As a part of our team, the Senior Developer will support customers and partners with architectural design, development, third-party integration strategy, and application performance tuning. The Developer role is a dynamic customer-facing position that requires previous consulting or services experience.

Job Responsibilities

Exceed your billable utilization target
Manage multiple application development projects simultaneously
Assist with the development of service estimates as required
Provide best practice advice and guidance to clients and partner development teams
Administer high-quality technical consultancy and implementation work at partner and/or client location
Participate in partner's projects in-house or on-site delivering production-ready code and troubleshooting live/development environments.
Develop, customize and implement features based on Optimizely's products upon request
Please note, this role will be working closely with our US team so working hours will be from 4:00pm - 12:00am (GMT+6)
Work week will be Monday through Friday

Knowledge And Experience

Prior experience in .NET projects: .NET, ASP.NET

Flash developers are involved in developing web based applications using a Flash-based system. They create a variety of web content and application programs for gaming, advertisements, web introduction, and other interactive web interface. They are proficient in using Adobe Flash or other flash applications, but they work mostly on ActionScript 2.0 and 3.0.

Key Responsibilities

The main responsibility of a flash developer is to develop and maintain the user interface on a website and create varied websites with interactive user interface. They have to create various micro-sites full of advertising campaigns, gaming links, flash based animation, and other user based applications. They are also involved in developing mobile based flash programs for iOS and Android apps that utilize Adobe AIR development platform.

The Key Responsibilities Of a Flash Developer Comprise

Designing and creating the application program, software tools, and program code as per the clients' requirement; developing concepts and story lines according to the theme; and writing script for film animation accordingly
Developing related User Interface codes as per themes and designs, performing test run and debugging them accordingly for providing quality animation product for program development
Collaborating with creative producer, studio team, and creative team for implementing innovative and groundbreaking user interface for target audience and developing clear and concise user interface codes that cover all the latest features and provide user-friendly web integration
Collaborating with creative studio team for developing web interface with multi-level interface like foreign language integration, multimedia selection, and 3D gaming technology
Incorporating RSS and social media integration in the website for extending the ad campaigning limits, integrating gaming and other consoles in social media network for extending the web reach of newly developed games and animation in the website, and providing constant assistance in carrying out the maintenance of RSS and social media feeds
Coordinating with creative teams for conceptualizing online projects like advertisements, gaming, animation projects, online presentations, and other website integration, developing user interface codes accordingly for providing proper animation product and prototype to the organization
Coordinating with senior managers for determining overall project development, working in a collaborative environment for providing direction for achieving the project goal, and providing support to the company
Providing extensive support to the creative team for integrating new script code with animations technology, creating interactive projects in accordance with the theme, and assisting them on technological processes accordingly throughout project implementation
Managing all the process of application development from concept development process to post-production tasks, communicating with inter-department teams for providing support and feedback regarding completed projects, and coordinating with quality assurance team, technical analysts, and software development team for resolving various issues in maintaining quality control
Developing scalable and versatile interactive Flash application on XML platform, implementing it accordingly as per the requirement, and providing direct support to the development team for the development process to develop technologically or creatively superior deliveries

"flash designing", "flash animation", "flash builder"

job_title: Local Partner Network - SEA 2023 LOT 9 – Democracy, Human Rights, Rule of Law, Gender Equality and Human Rights Based Approach (HRBA), South Asia
name_location: NTU International A/S South Asia Remote
job_description:
Local Partner Network – SEA Framework LOT 9 – Democracy, Human Rights, Rule of Law, Gender Equality and Human Rights Based Approach (HRBA)

Profile: Local Experts and/or companies
Location: South Asia
Deadline: 13/02/2023

NTU International is a leading international consulting firm providing programme management and advisory services for development projects worldwide. For almost three decades, NTU has been delivering sustainable development projects and advisory services within engineering, policy, economics, and social fields. With more than 1.100 international projects and studies already completed, and 16 project offices around the world, we have established ourselves as a leading consulting company. With the expansion of international activities and clients, NTU’s project pipeline and opportunities have grown significantly, therefore, we are looking for a motivated and result oriented individual, who is interested in experiencing our culture, intensive business environment, challenges as well as being part of our international success.

NTU is leading a consortium for the EU SIEA 2023 Framework LOT 9 – Democracy, Human Rights, Rule of Law, Gender Equality and Human Rights Based Approach (HRBA) and we are looking to expand our network with skilled local partners from the target countries.

The relevant sectors for this project are the following:

Macroeconomic analysis
Public finance management
Domestic revenue mobilistation
Budget Support

We invite interested local experts and companies to confirm their interest by submitting a short application for our Local Partner Network in your region.

If you are interested in this position, please apply and upload your profile with information on:

Name of local partner
Country of registration
Country(ies) where the entity is operating
Short description of the organisation you represent

Please also make sure that you include one or more telephone numbers.

NTU will register your interest and should there be a specific opportunity in the country of your operation we will contact you with specific details.

We encourage all applicants to follow us on LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/company/ntu-international/

Only selected candidates will be contacted.

Grafana Labs is looking for a Strategic Account Executive who will be responsible for prospecting and closing new business across Australia. You will identify, nurture and close opportunities with both new and existing customers, manage forecasts and track customer data. We're strong proponents of a consultative sales approach - learn about the customer's needs first before talking products. Your expertise will be critical in helping articulate the value of our products, work with the customer during the trial phase and hand off a strong relationship to our Customer Success team.

Responsibilities

Meet and exceed individual quarterly and annual sales goals
Manage all aspects of the sales process (prospecting, sales meetings, product demos, proofs of concept, proposals, negotiations and account management)
Cultivate sales through outbound prospecting and inbound leads
Be able to understand and convey the value of both Grafana Cloud and Grafana Enterprise
Become an expert in managing your sales pipeline in Salesforce
Manage pipeline creation, order processing, and day-to-day customer requests

Requirements

5+ Years of Experience in Infrastructure Technology Sales
10 years of software sales experience
Experience prospecting into Fortune 100 companies
Located in Australia
Demonstrated history of consistent goal achievement in a highly competitive environment (top 10% performer)
Familiarity selling open source technology
Experience using Command of the Message and MEDD(P)ICC

About Grafana Labs: There are more than 950,000 active installations of Grafana around the globe, monitoring everything from beehives to climate change in the Alps. The instantly recognizable dashboards have been spotted everywhere from a NASA launch and Minecraft HQ to Wimbledon and the Tour de France. Grafana Labs also helps companies including Bloomberg, JPMorgan Chase, and eBay manage their observability strategies with full-stack offerings that can be run fully managed with Grafana Cloud, or self-managed with Grafana Enterprise Stack. The Grafana stack has grown to include four other open source projects, Grafana Loki (for logs), Grafana Tempo (for traces), Grafana Mimir (for metrics), and Grafana OnCall (for on-call management).

Benefits: For more information about the perks and benefits of working at Grafana, please check out our careers page.

A note about covid-19: All Grafanistas who wish to attend in-person events or travel for Grafana Labs must be fully-vaccinated.

Equal Opportunity Employer: At Grafana Labs we’re building a company where a diverse mix of talented people want to come, stay, and do their best work. We know that our company runs on the hard work and the dedication of our passionate and creative employees. If you're excited about this role but your experience doesn’t align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyways.

We will recruit, train, compensate and promote regardless of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, disability, age, veteran status, and all the other fascinating characteristics that make us different and unique. We believe that equality and diversity builds a strong organisation and we’re working hard to make sure that’s the foundation of our organisation as we grow.

For information about how your personal data is used once you’ve applied to a job, check out our privacy policy.

job_title: Reporter, VICE World News, South Asia (12-months renewable contract)
job_description:
Role x You
VICE World News is looking for a reporter to cover South Asia.

This reporter would be based out of a South Asia city, outside of India. The right candidate has an excellent news sense, the ability to find new or underreported angles and stories, and a strong appetite for bold reporting that breaks news and starts conversations around the world whether in text, socials, or vertical video format. The reporter role is fast-paced and demanding; you should expect to pitch original stories on a daily basis, juggle multiple assignments and leads on an ongoing basis, and file multiple articles per week. This is a position for someone eager to learn a lot and who can balance trending news stories with honing and refining their mastery of one or more core VICE News beats (including inequality, climate, extremism, politics, and identity).
Clean, quick copy and a readiness to pick up the phone (or hit the pavement) are all must-haves in this role. Experience with digital video or audio is a plus, but not required. This role will report into the South Asia news editor.

Responsibilities:
Ideate and pitch reported stories on a daily basis; you should be an ideas machine and we’ll partner you with the right editor to bring those ideas to life
Report and file several clean, thoroughly sourced stories per week that will appeal to a global audience
Consistently publish creative enterprise work and scoops; your goal is to move the needle and start conversations on your beat

A collaborative spirit, and the ability to work across teams and with other reporters

VICE Media Group’s portfolio includes Refinery29, the leading global media and entertainment company focused on women; PULSE Films, a London-based next-generation production studio with outposts in Los Angeles, New York, Paris and Berlin; and i-D, a global digital and bimonthly magazine defining fashion and contemporary culture and design.

job_title: IT Oracle Configuration - Argus Safety Implementation (Japanese speaker)
job_description:
SUMMARY
Primary role of the consultant is to contribute and lead end to end drug safety system implementation which covers customer interactions, conduct workshop, requirement gathering, develop solutions and design, process optimization, system configuration, validation & testing, provide training , system installation, and post production support.


Typical projects include implementation, customization, upgrades & enhancements of products both on-premises and on cloud. Principal consultant shall take complete ownership of end to end activities during product implementation cycles by providing domain, Oracle drug safety products & services and solution skills in an individual as well as team capacity.


Key technical areas include Pre Sales support, Argus safety solutions, Argus Analytics, Pharmacovigilance Operations, Pharmacovigilance Systems, PV, Argus Product Configuration, Data migration, computer System Validation (CSV), GAMP5, E2B R2/R3, and Implementation.


RESPONSIBILITIES
Support presales activities; develop response for proposals, Argus safety solutions, approach, estimate effort and pricing.
Lead the customer meeting during the presales discussion, negotiate and contribute in contracts development.
Planning, managing, executing and closure of various tasks involved in drug safety system implementation
Conduct workshop, Involve in the business discussions with customer's Pharmacovigilance department executives in order to design the necessary configuration of the Argus Safety Suite, review business process, Impact/gap analysis, develop requirement specification
Design of Argus Safety suite solution for the customer.
Design and development of extensive product customization
Configuration of aggregate reports such as, PADER, DSUR, CSPR etc.
Safety Data assessment and develop scripts using PL/SQL programing
Develop Data migration scripts.
Develop Custom Reports
Conduct end to end implementation of Argus system
Experience in implementing CSV process improvements that is in line with ISPE's GAMP 5 principles.
Contribute to 21 CFR Part 11 and EU Annex 11 compliance
Build the assets, reusable accelerators, best practices & process for safety system implementation
Assure the quality of all the implementation documentation
Support and educate to safety system end users and sponsors
Triage and analyze issues and provide solutions.


DESIRED SKILLS
Very good understanding of Argus Safety Database.
Very good experience in PL/SQL programing, OBIEE,BIP, ODI
Strong end to end Argus system implementation experience for Global and Japan customers.
Thorough knowledge of Argus Configurations including reporting Rules, Workflows, E2B, Aggregate Reporting, EDI
Minimum 8 years drug safety regulated environment working experience
Experience with the Middle tier – ESM module, to configure profiles/DTDs Axway/Gateway Support
Experience Argus Product configuration, upgrade, Custom Reports Development and data migrations
Experience in Computer System Validation (CSV) and Testing
Good knowledge on GxP regulations – GAMP 5, 21 CFR Part 11, Annexure 11 , E2B R2/R3 regulatory guidelines.
Strong customer management skills
Good technical writing skills
Good team management skills
Must be well organized, and ability to prioritize work
Ability to work with culturally diverse and virtual teams.
Ability to work in an onsite offshore delivery model.
Hands-on working attitude.
Open to short international travel to customer locations for meetings and discussions.
Strong business acumen, communication and interpersonal skills.
Professional with strong planning and analytical skills.
Experiences in Pharmacovigilance Operations


QUALIFICATIONS
Minimum 10+ years' experience in the IT/ Software solutions and services industry.
8 + years of experience in Argus safety system implementation.
MUST HAVE Japanese and English language fluency
Very good experience and knowledge of the Pharmacovigilance system and database.
Very strong Presales, Solution Design , System configuring, Reports development ,Validation and Testing experience
Minimum of 3 Years of experience as a Lead and mentor the team
Minimum of Bachelor's degree.


DURATION
Freelance 6-12month project, can consider part-time and full-time candidates (0.4-1.0FTE)


SALARY
Attractive hourly pay rate


LOCATION
Fully remote anywhere in APAC


ABOUT PLANET PHARMA
Planet Pharma is an American parented Employment Business/Agency that provides global staffing services with its head-quarters in Chicago and our EMEA regional office located in Central London. We have invested significantly in creating a robust international platform that enables us to work compliantly in 30+ countries with a current network of 2500+ active contractors globally as well as a very strong permanent / direct hire recruitment offering.


Our specialist knowledge and close relationships with our clients and the wider industry really makes us unique in our field. Just recently we were recognised by FORBES as the 17th best professional staffing firm, and have won multiple awards from industry accredited bodies for our commitment to excellence and service delivery. We have extensive functional expertise including: Regulatory Affairs, Pharmacovigilance, QA, QC, Submissions experts, Clinical development, Quality, Biostatistics, and Medical Affairs / Writing.


We are an equal opportunities Recruitment Business and Agency. We welcome applications from all suitably qualified candidates regardless of their race, sex, disability, religion/belief, sexual orientation or age.

ApplyBoard simplifies the study abroad search, application, and acceptance process by connecting international students, recruitment partners, and academic institutions on one platform. With an exceptional team from around the world and speaking more than 75 languages, our diversity is one of our greatest strengths. Our core values, such as Caring About Each Other, Innovating and Improving, and Making Work Fun, propel us forward together and continuously strengthen our engaging culture. We are in growth mode and are looking to empower passionate and exceptionally talented team members.

The Opportunity:

We are looking for an experienced, well connected, organized International Recruitment Officer in India to join our growing Sales team and take our company and platform to the next level!

What you’ll be doing every day:

On a daily basis, identify, call, explain and enroll new student recruitment partners for Applyboard.
You are expected to call, organize, and have virtual meetings with about 10 potential partners every day
This is a high-performance role requiring you to generate leads, call, meet and be in touch with the potential Recruitment Partners
The role will include substantial Inbound/ Outbound calling; virtual meetings; Recruitment Partner communications to ensure an end to end hassle-free experience

What you bring to the table:

The candidate should ideally have at least 2+ years of experience
Experience in the study abroad education industry is an asset
Strong communication skills
Excellent command over the English language
Able to manage multiple tasks simultaneously

Life at ApplyBoard:

By joining our team, you have the opportunity to:

Join the fastest-growing technology company in Canada, with many opportunities for growth and advancement
Work alongside a globally diverse team of over 1,500 team members based in over 25 countries, who speak more than 75 languages.
Make a difference in the lives of thousands of students as they explore educational opportunities
Want to learn more about ApplyBoard, read our Life at ApplyBoard Blog, and be sure to follow us on our LinkedIn page.

About ApplyBoard

ApplyBoard empowers students around the world to access the best education by simplifying the study abroad search, application, and acceptance process to more than 1,500 institutions across Canada, Australia, the United States, and the United Kingdom. ApplyBoard, headquartered in Kitchener, Ontario, Canada, has helped more than 300,000 students from more than 125 countries along their educational journeys since 2015.

ApplyBoard was named the fastest-growing technology company in Canada by Deloitte, ranking #1 on the Technology Fast 50™ list in 2019 and #2 in 2020.

ApplyBoard was also been named to LinkedIn’s list of Top Startups in 2020 and 2021 and TechTO’s list of top Canadian Rocketship companies to accelerate your career in the Tech Industry.

In 2021, ApplyBoard announced a C$375M Series D funding on a C$4B valuation. This funding will allow us to further invest in our technology, grow our team around the world, and serve more students on our mission to educate the world. Thank you for your interest in ApplyBoard. Please note that only qualified applicants that have been selected for an interview will be contacted.

ApplyBoard is committed to providing an inclusive and diverse workplace and is an equal opportunity employer. If you require any accommodations or assistance during the recruitment process, please let us know.

NTU International is a leading international consulting firm providing programme management and advisory services for development projects worldwide. With more than 1.100 international projects and studies already completed, and 16 project offices around the world, we have established ourselves as a leading consulting company. With the expansion of international activities and clients, NTU’s project pipeline and opportunities have grown significantly, therefore, we are looking for a motivated and result oriented individual, who is interested in experiencing our culture, intensive business environment, challenges as well as being part of our international success.

About The Company

One of the fastest-growing and most trusted companies in blockchain security, CertiK is a true market leader. To date, CertiK has worked with over 3,200 Enterprise clients, secured over $310 billion worth of digital assets, and has detected over 60,000 vulnerabilities in blockchain code. Our clients include leading projects such as Aave, Polygon, Binance Smart Chain, Terra, Yearn, and Chiliz.

Investors = Insight Partners, Sequoia, Tiger Global, Coatue Management, Lightspeed, Advent International, SoftBank, Hillhouse Capital, Goldman Sachs, Coinbase Ventures, Binance, Shunwei Capital, IDG Capital, Wing, Legend Star, Danhua Capital and other investors.

About The Role

CertiK is looking for a communications professional to join our team. This role will be part communications strategist and part community manager where the ideal candidate for this role will work around the design of tools and solutions that empower a broad array of stakeholders to participate in blockchain security more deeply and meaningfully. This role will vary from day to day and will include activities such as: codifying communications workflows, setting up and managing new communication channels or tools, working with stakeholders to understand informational needs of ongoing projects or deals, and drafting content for a variety of audiences.

Though technical knowledge is not a prerequisite for this role, the context of this work is highly technical and strong candidates should be passionate about Web3, blockchain technology, ecosystems and motivated by the mission of CertiK. Our team is diverse and interdisciplinary, and we welcome your interesting, non-traditional, and/or early career experiences.

Responsibilities
Scoping communications needs around project teams to provide a holistic and collaborative approach toward securing the project.
Developing and codifying reporting standards, communications workflows, and best practices guidelines.
Creatively address the launch and management of different communications tools with a wide array of channels/instruments and approaches. (E.g., e.g., feedback surveys, infographics, Twitter spaces, AMAs, email newsletters, Twitter feed, etc.)
Develop and manage the writing of technical and non-technical materials for both internal and external audiences, including case studies, blog posts, and weekly community updates ensuring content accuracy, consistency, and completeness to capture public interest about engineering and product innovations for different stakeholder groups
Devising success metrics for communications tools and procedures and using them to drive continuous improvement
Creatively addressing communications needs with a wide array of tools and approaches (e.g., feedback surveys, infographics, Twitter spaces, AMAs, etc.)
Provides leadership in the design and delivering communications expertise to other teams and community partners providing resources and coaching as necessary to achieve mutual goals.
Build templates and guidelines for communication principles, audience lists, scripting standards, and key messages.
Scheduling, planning, and executing in-person events and activities, including speaker series and team offsites events.
Ability to speak clearly and concisely to an audience with technical and non-technical knowledge, both virtually and in person, about work being conducted by the team.
Collaborate and build relationships with a diverse array of stakeholders, as well as network stewards across both blockchain ecosystems to support complex deals, projects and proactively contribute to improvement plans in the organization.

Requirements
Leadership experience managing complex stakeholder projects and sensitive partnerships.
Hyper detail-oriented, extremely organized, and pride yourself on your ability to structure large, ambiguous systems into sensible, tractable ones.
Previous experience in professional communications, particularly communicating technical information to non-technical audiences.
Comfort interacting with the public, ability to build relationships with a diverse group of stakeholders, and the ability for conflict resolution.
Able to execute the details while managing the big picture.
Comfortable managing different “depths” of work simultaneously.
Ability to balance interests of many activities with good communication and listening skills, with the ability to teach others.
You relish coordinating workflows across different teams inside multiple organizations.
Passion for decentralization, information access, and solving complex web3 issues.

Bonus Points
Fluency in English, and one of Mandarin, Korean.
Management experience leading teams or individuals within an organization.
Previous experience in other decentralized communities, and/or working knowledge of decentralized governance schemas and tooling.
Experience working with and/or contributing to open-source software projects.
Voracious learner and self-taught professional.

Compensation:

The exact compensation at which this job is filled will be determined by the skills and experience of qualified candidates.

If you are looking to work on the next generation of digital technologies in a fast-paced and growing environment with industry leaders, Optimizely is the place for you!

Introduction

As a Contracts Manager with Optimizely, the successful candidate will help accelerate Optimizely’s success by providing practical, creative, thoughtful, and quick answers to key contractual questions. The Contracts Manager will be required to draft, negotiate, and manage a wide variety of supplier agreements, with a high focus SaaS, Marketing and Contingent Worker/Consulting agreements. The successful candidate will assist with the continuous development of the contracts function and its processes. Optimizely’s Procurement function is diligent and proactive and works cross–functionally with all areas of the company in a collaborative, collegial, fast-paced, global team environment, while this position will be part of the Procurement team it will work very closely with our Legal function.

Job Responsibilities

Write, review, draft, and negotiate vendor/supplier agreements including software license agreements, professional services agreements, partner agreements, contract addenda
Identify terms that vary from corporate standards to ensure accuracy and compliance, recommend appropriate modifications, engage and collaborate with internal stakeholders in the IT, Marketing, professional services, legal, and other internal organizations as may be required
Provide effective guidance of contract issues to management
Assist with establishment of initiatives for vendor/supplier contracts within the procurement function, including contracting tools and processes, legal language library, reference materials, and playbooks
Provide guidance on contracting practices and procedures to employees and managers
Advise Stakeholders of contractual rights and obligations and provide clarification of contract terms and conditions
Act as a liaison between internal and external vendors/suppliers to efficiently drive the contract review and approval process to conclusion
Act as the liaison between the various company departments and the Legal Department on the preparation, review, and execution of vendor/supplier agreements
Develop processes and analytics to track instances of non-compliance and develop a plan to minimize future incidents
Provide training to stakeholders on how to distinguish commercial and legal terms and tips for negotiating the commercial terms
Assist in review and response to Vendor/supplier contract enquiries, offering appropriate alternatives to contract terms and conditions
Prepare and administer routine and/or specialized correspondence as an when neccessary
Assist in other contracts management duties that may arise from time to time

Knowledge And Experience

'

Excellent written and verbal communication and negotiation skills
Ability to interface with all levels globally
Ability to handle and resolve conflicts in a professional and tactful manner
Strong analytical skills and interpersonal skills with ability to effectively work in a team environment and under general supervision
Strong understanding of contract provisions and risks and the legal areas and laws that impact them
Ability to mentor within the department and train other departments on company contract policies
Successfully accomplish work with a high degree of independence balance competing priorities with short lead times
Effectively analyze significant, and/or unique contract requirements, special provisions, terms and conditions to ensure compliance with appropriate laws, regulations, and corporate policies and communicates results
Proficiency in MS Office, especially Word and Excel, is required.
Ability to work within the Procurement tool and processes.

Education

7-10 years of experience in the creation, negotiation, preparation, administration, and monitoring technology-related agreements
4+ years of experience with SaaS and/or enterprise software agreements is required
Experience with other agreements such as Marketing, contingent workers/contractors, consultancy.
Intellectual curiosity about Optimizely’s procurement processes, vendors, products/technology, and contract provisions
Bachelor’s degree, or equivalent is a plus

Overview

Role: Deputy Manager/ Senior Executive - Internal Audit
This position shall be based in Head Office, Dhaka and will report to Head of Internal Audit and Internal Control.

Key Role:
This position will be responsible for providing functional support to carry out process/operational audit assignments as per the annual Internal Audit Plan approved by the Audit Committee. This position will also coordinate the Head of Department to prepare the deliberations for Audit Committee meetings. Apart from the regular Internal Audit assignments, this Position will have participated in special audit and Investigation as when mandated by the Management of the Company. There will be responsibilities of Internal Control function under the portfolio of this Position. This position shall be responsible to perform internal audit, special investigations and internal control activities covering a wide array of business functions located in Head Office, Industrial sites, Shipping stations, Regional Sales Offices as well as the different product brands & solutions of the Company. Strong focus on compliance at work will be the key success parameter of this Position.

Main Responsibilities
Preparation of internal audit plan: Coordinate the Head of Internal Audit and Internal Control for preparing the annual internal audit plan to be approved by the Audit Committee
Conduct process/operational audits: Conduct risk based audits on various business processes/operations/functions as per the annual Internal Audit plan approved by the Audit Committee. Review specific business/operational issues as per request of the cross-functional team to recommend on possible solution and/or improvement opportunities. Special emphasis shall be on areas of improvement to bring operational efficiency and effectiveness.
Perform special audit and investigations: Perform special audits and investigations whenever advised by the Top Management.
Preparation of Audit Reports: After completion of the audit/review assignments, audit reports shall have to be prepared with the observations and recommendations that need to be discussed and agreed with the concerned function for finalization of the Reports.
Carry out Internal control activities: Carry out internal control activities as per the Group Internal Control instructions. Conduct sessions with the Control Owners and Approvers to ensure effective design and implementation of the recommended internal controls in place. Perform Control testing as per the schedule recommended by the Group IC Function.
Participate in Enterprise Risk Management (ERM) exercise: Participate in Enterprise Risk Management (ERM) exercise aligned with Group Risk Management team. Conduct sessions with the head of Functions and key Managers of the concerned Functions to identify the Risks and mitigation plans considering the Risk Library of the Group. Follow up of the Management actions to implement the risk mitigation plans within the agreed timeline and report the same in the Group reporting tool/Portal.

Develop/update the Business Policies, Procedures and Operating Standards considering the Group Policies, Procedures and Standards. job_description: HVAC Plumbing and fire fighting design and drafting. I have 5 years experience in various project . I worked with Thai Japanese and Singaporean.

*This opening is for relocation to our HQ in Cyberjaya, Malaysia*

Our team
You will be part of our Quality Assurance team. We are software testing engineers who execute high-quality tests to refine our wide range of products and services. We look after the quality, usability, and stability of our websites and trading platforms to deliver a world-class experience to our end users.

Your role
You will be responsible for creating and executing performance test plans and strategies for the upkeep of our apps and websites. As a Performance Tester, you and the rest of the Quality Assurance (QA) team will identify potential bottlenecks related to our websites, apps, and infrastructure and recommend effective solutions. You must be familiar with every aspect of the performance testing process and maintain a high-quality standard throughout the process.

You will participate in global projects as we scale our business operations to meet the demands of our ever-growing client base. It is important that you are prepared to expand the scope of your role.

Your challenges
Analyse website, application, and infrastructure performance requirements, set objectives, design, and integrate automated and manual testing frameworks into internal and external workflows
Coordinate with IT teams to find the root causes of performance issues and provide corrective actions. Review the test results and configure analysis graphs and create performance test results reports
Decide on the suitable tools to use for performance testing for the applications and develop and maintain the performance test scripts
Identify and investigate issues/bugs and implement testing systems for better performance of the websites, applications, back-end infrastructure, and related systems. Analyse the performance of the software to different numbers of virtual and live users while monitoring performance measurements under different loads
Present the issues discovered internally and reported by our clients and the Client Support team to the rest of the QA team. Assist in updating and documenting the QA team's internal processes and manual guides
Compare the production performance and staging environment performance results of Deriv’s systems before releasing them to production

What you have
Minimum of 4 years experience in a software or web application testing role
A bachelor’s degree in computer science, or an equivalent combination of technical education, training, and work experience
Competency in writing high-quality, self-documenting code using test-driven development techniques
Experience in performance and load testing
Experience in designing and executing test plans (both automated and manual)
Proficiency in Agile development methods such as Scrum or Kanban
Experience working with Linux and other open-source platforms
Familiarity with Git
Understanding of the latest technologies such as JMeter and LoadRunner
Excellent spoken and written English communication skills

What’s good to have
Experience with PostgreSQL or another RDBMS
Extensive knowledge of JavaScript, AJAX, JSON, and CSS
Aptitude in programming languages like Perl, Python, PHP, C/C++, etc.

What we’ll give you
The best workplace you can possibly imagine, a gorgeous 5-story building including a rooftop garden, a gym, squash court, yoga room, barbecue pit, jam studio, and a lot more!
A chance to work with top talent from across the globe (55+ nationalities)
Ample team-building and bonding activities
Great overseas travel opportunities
Competitive salary, annual performance bonus, and retirement plan
A range of health benefits
Casual dress code

About us
We’re Deriv. We’re all about trading. We’re the geeky upstarts who pioneered an industry. That was more than 20 years ago, and we’re still going strong. Today, we work across continents and serve over 2.5 million traders from around the globe.

Join us. Grow with us.

Location
Cyberjaya, Malaysia

job_title: Senior Full Stack Engineer 5+ years experiences must need (JavaScript, Node, React)

We’re looking for a great Senior Full Stack Engineer who have 5 years+ experiences to join our team & work on a fantastic opportunity.

We want people who are passionate about creating software that makes a difference to
the world. We like people who are brimming with ideas and who take initiative rather than wait to
be told what to do. We prize team-first mentality, personal responsibility and tenacity to solve hard
problems and meet deadlines. As part of a small and lean team, you will have a very direct impact on
the success of the company.

What you will do:

Design, develop, and maintain JavaScript-based, React and Node.js applications.
Implement, update and maintain back-end and front-end components. We try to cater for

Follow best coding practices, and create code that you are proud of, with extensibility,
scalability and performance in mind.

Help level up the team; share knowledge, conduct code and design review; drive code
quality and process improvement initiatives.

Solid Computer Science fundamentals, excellent problem-solving skills.

Good communication skills (written and verbal), proven team player, rolling up the sleeve and getting involved in the nitty gritty.

Able to work within the GMT+8 time zone
5+ years job experiences is must be needed.

What we offer:

An exciting and passionate working environment within a young and fast-growing company
The opportunity to work with a high performing team
The ability to work from anywhere in the world (assuming a stable internet connection)The chance of being a fundamental part of the team and make a difference

Salary: 80,000 BDT/Month

What will the process look like?

If you are selected from the over the calling interview you will be given an online application form, which will take you less than 10 mins to complete
Test: you will take a 45 min online test
Interview: there will be 1-2 rounds of interviews

We are in search of a Marine Mechanic to repair and service marine engines and vessels for our clients. You should be able to inspect and identify any malfunctions. You should also be able to visit docking stations and perform mechanical operations on the vessels at halt.

job_title: Head of Grants; Global Resource Mobilisation & Partnerships
job_description:
Job Purpose: The Head of Grants is responsible for participating in the development of global procedures in grant management, and actively promoting the application of those procedures toward an efficient and effective grant management function within the Bangladesh Head Office. The role has four main aspects to it:
Work within GRP Grant Management team to develop key policies, procedures and tools for grant and sub-grant management across BRAC Bangladesh,
Advise, develop and build capacity of the Programme grant management function in line with complexity of portfolio;
Practice active risk management by monitoring key performance indicators and grant metrics within Programmes for senior management within BRAC Bangladesh on overall portfolio health;
Directly and operationally manage a high-risk, multi-sector grant portfolio of BRAC Bangladesh.

The role offers a leadership opportunity for an individual experienced in grants management, change management and people management. It requires an individual capable of providing direct supervision and technical dotted-line leadership to a dynamic team responsible for the management of the BRAC Bangladesh portfolio of grants currently valued at $371M. This position will work in close partnership with colleagues within GRP and with all Programme teams to ensure a smooth end-to-end process from proposal development to donor contract review to grant close out planning and to build overall BRAC Bangladesh capacity to deliver quality projects that are grant funded. In the event of a major humanitarian emergency inside Bangladesh, the role holder will be expected to work outside the normal role profile and be able to vary working hours accordingly.


Key Responsibilities:
Support the Director of Grant Management, GRP in the creation of global policies, procedures and tools relevant to Grant Management including representing Bangladesh views and perspectives to refreshed grant and sub-grant management procedures.
Support the Director of Grant Management in the embedding of the Grant Management function within and across the Bangladesh Head Office. To be done through deliberate and tailored capacity development plans to Programmes.
Develop strong relationships across BRAC Bangladesh; provide direct supervision and dotted line supervision and support to BRAC Bangladesh Grant Focal Points including:
-Direct supervision of GRP Senior Grant Manager
-Direct supervision of the GRP Grant Manager
-Support recruitment of Grant Focal Points within Programmes
-Provide technical input into Grant Management Staff and Focal Points, either through formal performance objectives or softer coaching
-Input into formal performance evaluations or give feedback through softer coaching techniques
-Provide regular, ongoing support to Grant Focal Points
-Directly manage the Bangladesh Grant Focal Point Community of Practice (COP)
Build a high performing grant management team across BRAC Head Office through regular and ongoing capacity building and donor compliance advising to GRP and Programme Grant Management staff through:
-On-the-job training support to select Grant Focals
-Workshops on select, strategic topics alone or in collaboration with other Departments
-Acting as a real-time advisory capacity = for grant management queries and issues
-Facilitation of sharing grant management capacity across Programme and sites to promote opportunity and learning
Support Director to convene all Bangladesh Grant Management staff regularly and govern the COP for BRAC Bangladesh
Ensure that key staff (including downstream partners) have a clear understanding of donor compliance requirements throughout the project management cycle. This includes serving as an internal control function for BRAC Bangladesh Programmes through:
-Review of donor solicitations from a compliance perspective
-Review of high value budgets from a compliance perspective
-Review of donor contracts
-Support Finance and Programmes with preparation for, and management responses to grant specific audits
-Serve as compliance helpdesk
-Support operationalization of Sub-Grant Management procedures through central reviews/approvals of Downstream Due Diligences as well as sub-grant contracts.
Oversee the direct management of BRAC Bangladesh’s high-risk, multi-sector grant portfolio through application of grant and sub-grant management procedures.
Support the training and adoption by BRAC Bangladesh Grant Focals of the Grant Management System; ensure that system is effectively maintained and up to date for all grants and sub-grants including authorization and document retention
Analyze Bangladesh-specific grant portfolio data for quarterly dashboards, high level monthly reviews, set up and monitor grant KPIs and produce management reporting for senior management
Work in collaboration with other Departments to ensure grant management inputs to key processes including, inter alia, cost allocation, timesheets, audit responses.
Ensure that grant management processes include consideration of key organizational priorities (Gender and Inclusion, Safeguarding).

Safeguarding Responsibilities:
Ensure the safety of team members from any harm, abuse, neglect, harassment and exploitation to achieve the programme’s goals on safeguarding implementation. Act as a key source of support, guidance and expertise on safeguarding for establishing a safe working environment.
Practice, promote and endorse the issues of safeguarding policy among team members and ensure the implementation of safeguarding standards in every course of action.
Follow the safeguarding reporting procedure in case any reportable incident takes place, encourage others to do so.

Educational Requirements:
Masters or equivalent degree in International Development/ Business Administration/ Finance

Experience Requirements:
10+ years experience in development or related field having core experience in grants management as well as in change management using global standard grant management tools and procedures.

Additional Requirements:
Proven track record of active contribution to senior management team direction, and providing strategic support across multiple sectors and/or regions
Extensive experience with NGOs with increasing responsibilities including proven experience of establishing and running the grant management function in the field
Knowledge of the requirements of major institutional donors including budgeting, eligibility issues, compliance management, and reporting; experience of engaging with donors at a strategic level (UNHCR, USAID, GAC, DFAT, DFID)
Donor compliance knowledge and experience in dotted line management.
Well-developed skills in staff management.
Proven coaching and capacity building skills
Understanding of the financial aspects of grant management, ability to work with Finance Departments on grant management issues
Strong attention to detail, problem solving skills, and ability to analyze trends
Computer literate (i.e. Google Suite/ Word, Excel, Outlook, Internet Explorer, financial systems)
Patient, adaptable, able to improvise, and communicate clearly and effectively under pressure
Fluent communication (written and spoken) in English and Bengali
Demonstrated ability to manage change in complex organizations
Knowledge of BRAC, its history, and its Programmes and culture desirable


Salary: Negotiable
Other Benefits: Festival Bonus, Contributory Provident Fund, Gratuity, Health and Life Insurance, Car Allowance and others.
Job Location: BRAC Head Office (Dhaka, Bangladesh)
Last Apply Date: January 28, 2023
Other applying procedure: You may send your updated CV to resume@brac.net mentioning the name of the position in the subject line.

BRAC believes that everyone we work with including our staff, programme participants, partners and the community have the right to be protected from all forms of harm, abuse, neglect, harassment, and exploitation. We uphold human dignity and inclusion for all, regardless of age, race, religion, gender, disability, ethnic origin or socio-economic condition. As an equal opportunity employer, we actively encourage applications from gender- diverse individuals and people with disabilities. Any personal persuasion will result in disqualification of candidature.

BitMEX is the world’s leading cryptocurrency derivatives trading platform, which has pioneered cryptocurrency trading through relentless commitment to change, and continues to set benchmarks for innovation, liquidity, and security today.

As the world's most advanced peer-to-peer crypto-products trading platform and API, BitMEX gives knowledge, confidence, and precision to hundreds of thousands of traders, transacting billions of USD a day.

Overview
The web engineer will be embedded into the Frontend engineering team, and will help ensure our web experience meets the needs of our customers. He/She will be responsible for building, testing, deploying and operating our web interfaces.

Responsibilities
Build/Test/Deploy/Operate services in production
Work within a cross functional team made up of both internal and external team members to deliver new features across our mobile apps and websites.
Development of the BitMEX Web Frontend components using React
Write test cases, unit tests, integration tests & E2E tests
Level 1 and 2 support

Qualifications
Intimate experience with JS and JS performance characteristics
Experience with NodeJS, React, and Flux architecture
Experience with Jest, Typescript, Webpack, Make, and Sass a plus
Experience making complex, data-driven products accessible to consumers
4+ years of relevant experience

Join us, as we build a thriving cryptocurrency ecosystem through strategic investments in emerging cryptocurrency technology, and create the future of digital financial services.

name_location: Woolworths Group Asia Dhaka, Bangladesh Hybrid
job_description:
Do you want to work in a fast paced and dynamic team that focused on delivering the right outcome for Woolworths Group, our shareholders, customers and communities?

Do you have outstanding experience in sustainability and are a collaborative influencer who can work with internal and external stakeholders to deliver change to drive outcomes?

Do you want to join a business with charismatic business leaders who put our employees 1st with ample learning and development opportunities?


Then join Woolworths (Big W - department store) as Sustainable Products Partner and be part of one of the largest retail groups in the world!

ROLE PURPOSE

Sustainable Products Partner is responsible to ensure we deliver sustainable product and supply chain requirements for all own brand products in the Big W business. . The partner must collaborate across the business with our team and our suppliers to support the delivery the 2025 sustainability plan for Own Brand products in BIGW .This role supports the delivery of the BIG W’s real care initiative and Better Together for a Better Tomorrow.

THE ROLE
Partner with our sourcing and commercial teams to deliver own brand products with sustainable attributes aligned to our 2025 sustainability plan .
Partner across the business to implement the Woolworths Group Cotton Policy within the BIGW business . Including reporting requirements aligned to the plan.
Implementation of policy and procedures which deliver sustainability requirements across our product ranges for both hardgoods or softgoods.
Implementation of the plan for the key sustainable materials to ensure the delivery of 100% sustainable products in our own brand range by 2025
Facilitate the implementation of the sustainable materials across the entire BIG W ecosystem from sourcing to customer.
Partners with both internal and external stakeholders to support their understanding of BIG W’s sustainability requirements and the key framework for delivery
Work with the Woolworths Group team to provide visibility of the BIG W sustainability roadmap for sustainable materials and the ongoing reporting and governance to ensure delivery to timeline.
WHO YOU ARE
Previous experience in managing sustainable materials across the softgoods supply chain plan
Strong understanding of the risks and challenges in softgoods and hardgoods supply chains regarding sustainability
Prior experience of managing large programs of work for delivery of key commitments
Prior experience of cotton / fabric sourcing in the Asia region is preferred
Self-motivated, highly responsible and ability to work effectively under pressure
Someone who is always eager to learn, grow, and develop
Be a great team player but also able to work independently
Have excellent communication skills in English in order to communicate well with our key stakeholders, suppliers and buyers

WHAT YOU WILL GAIN
Be a part of a multinational retail group
Constant mentoring and training provided
Fantastic development opportunities and long term career path
A market leading 20 days annual leave
Enjoy a 5 day working week within a business that values work-life balance and flexible hour arrangement

About Daraz:
Founded in 2015, Daraz is South Asia's leading e-commerce platform in Pakistan, Bangladesh, Sri Lanka, Nepal and Myanmar. It empowers more than 100,000 active sellers with world-class marketplace technology to reach the fast-growing consumer class in a region of 500 million people. Through Daraz Express and Daraz Pay, it operates the most efficient and digitalized logistics and payments infrastructure in its markets. Daraz' vision is to be a champion of South Asia, serving 50 million customers and businesses by 2030.

For more information, please visit www.daraz.com

name_location: Parker Wellbore Dhaka, Dhaka, Bangladesh On-site
job_description:
The Driller is a first line supervisor whose main duties are to direct and instruct the crew in the proper way to perform their duties and assigned tasks. This position is responsible for all operations pertaining to the drilling and completion of the well, including the circulating, rotating, hoisting, well control systems. It is the Driller’s responsibility to ensure that the work is performed safely, efficiently and according to procedure. The driller also takes total ownership of everything on the rig floor.

Essential functions

Provide visible leadership with a Total Ownership attitude. Owns safety standards.
Supervise and ensure the safety of drilling crew as well as efficient operations during tour of duty.
Enforce, clarify, and follow Company policies, standards, and procedures.
Follow the client’s daily drilling plans.
Promote operational excellence through procedural discipline.
Ensure crews achieve Company and client competency standards.
Train and supervise crew members on standard operating procedures to include, but not limited to, proper care and maintenance of the rig and drill string, including lubrication of equipment and housekeeping.
Delegate work effectively with a clear definition of requirements and expectations.
Responsible for morale and order within crew.
Ensure Authorized To Operate (ATO) and Approved Competent Operator (ACO) are applied and followed.
Ensure timely completion of accurate reports required by Company and client (including but not limited to daily drilling reports, pre-tour reports, hand-over notes, etc.).
Update the well control board on a tourly basis.
Maintain complete records of all tools and tubular run into the hole while drilling and/or reaming (including made up lengths, tool joints OD, ID, serial numbers).
Track rotating hours on tubular/BHA/Tools.
Maintain records of footage drilled, location and nature of strata penetrated, materials and tools used, services rendered and time required.
Monitor drilling parameters and alarm systems.
Monitor hole fill operations while tripping, logging, cutting drilling line or running casing.
Record pickup, slack-off, rotating weights, and other drilling parameters.
Operate drilling equipment
Maintain and adjust machinery in order to ensure proper performance.
Ensure floor and crown savers are function-tested and that testing results are recorded tourly.
Ensure proper alignment of choke manifold and BOP remote console.
Ensure performance of daily checks on FOSV, Kelly cock valve, IBOP, BPV.
Secure well during well control events, emergencies and drills.
Install and record pressure testing of BOPE.
Ensure rig equipment and locations are secured prior to rig moves.
Comply with emergency response plan or Work Safe Procedure during emergencies and/or drills.
Perform additional duties, responsibilities, and special projects as may be directed. Carries out an inspection of the operation control instrumentation, automatic and safety devices, condition of BOP equipment;

Qualifications

Necessary qualifications, skills and abilities

Able to identify and understand functionality of various rig equipment.
Able to identify and understand functionality of various tubular sizes and thread types.
Knowledgeable and proficient in basic rigger’s role to ensure safe lifting operations are performed.
Knowledgeable of mechanical systems and be skilled at working with hand and power tools.
Knowledgeable of and capable of operating gantry cranes, tubular shuttles, etc.
Can demonstrate knowledge and be able to function the following equipment: o Diverter, Well head, BOP and associated control equipment o Automated pipe handling equipment o Drilling control (Break Handle) and safety systems o Anti-collision surface equipment systems
Can demonstrate knowledge and execution of the following operations: o Drilling and well operations o Well integrity and well control o Dropped objects prevention o Line of fire, exclusion zone and safe zone operations o Pipe measurement, number, strapping and tallying of pipes o Tripping and back reaming o Running casing and completions o Troubleshooting downhole problems and equipment failures
Should have good verbal communication skills and be able to effectively communicate in English with staff, management, customers and vendors.
Must possess sound reasoning skills, common sense and the ability to follow directions.
Must possess basic mathematical skills (equivalent to a high school education) and be proficient in rig math.
Education, experience, and certifications: o High School diploma is required. o Must be able to obtain appropriate offshore or, onshore certifications o Should have at least 6 years of work experience as a Driller. secondary vocational education; admission to perform work on drilling wells over 5,000 meters deep, horizontal wells over 2,000 meters deep or when drilling wells with submersible drilling rig; certificate of Driller 8th grade and certificate of Workover Driller 8th grade (if required) Having minimum 2 years work experience working on a rig Basic information on the geology of oilfields and technology for the development of oil, gas, and other; - Engineering and geological program flow diagram; - Geological cross-section of the drilled area, information on well design;
Position competencies

People Management Provides team with a clear sense of direction and objectives; creates a stable and re-assuring work atmosphere; supports employment development through coaching, Highly integrated with strategic talent management processes including performance management, succession planning, talent development, and engagement/retention, etc. Get results through people.
Effective Communication Communicates in a clear, precise and structured way; speaks with authority and conviction; listens attentively and objectively.
Personal Accountability Demonstrates enthusiasm for and commitment to the position and accepts responsibility for personal actions. Takes pride in the job. Actively engages in professional self-development opportunities. Demonstrates professionalism and emotional intelligence across situations.
Flawless Execution Clearly defines priorities and objectives. Uses a systematic approach with commitment and determination to achieve high quality results. Capably leads the business day-to-day and evaluates the risks and rewards new opportunities present.
Physical demands and work environment

Oversee and manage the overall quality of projects and/or employee performance.
Ability to gather, analyze, and interpret data.
Ability to work around moving machinery
Ability to perform under stress, under pressure, and/or in emergency situations.
Lift, carry, and move objects of up to 50 pounds.
Operate machinery and/or power tools.
Ability to walk on uneven ground (gravel, rocks, mounds, ice)
Wear personal protective equipment, including but not limited to hard hat, steel-toed safety shoes, hearing protection, respirators, safety glasses, goggles and full body harness.
Frequently stand, walk, stoop, kneel, carry, push/pull, reach, and use repetitive wrist and hand movements.
Ability to ascend and descend ladders, stairs, scaffolding, and/or ramps while carrying tools requiring a reasonable degree of physical stamina and agility and involving moderate to severe physical exertion
Carry up to 10 lbs.
Operate motor vehicles and/or heavy equipment.

Job Description

About the role:

In this role as Product Specialist, Multiple Sclerosis (MS) you will disseminate scientific information to educate physicians on neurodegenerative diseases, develop collaborative relationships and help remove barriers to patient access to Biogen therapies.

Location: Field based in Eastern Providence (Dammam)

Who You Are

Prior relevant experience working as Product Specialist in MS/ Neuroscience or Specialty Care are preferred. You offer strong influencing and have persuasive skills. You enjoy working strategic, innovative, and bring analytical skills. We offer an agile and fast evolving environment where people thrive by being creative, flexible, acting daily as effective communicators as well as negotiator. You demonstrated in prior role(s) being service oriented with a long term vision, this means as well highly self-motivated with a good team spirit.

What You'll Do
Disseminate to healthcare professionals (HCPs) and Key Medical Experts (KMEs) in the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia (Territory Eastern Providence) information relating to Biogen registered products within authorized indications (as relevant to the Territory) in compliance with applicable law and Biogen policies.
Develop, maintain and apply strong understanding of neuroscience (multiple sclerosis) state, technical data, clinical practices, Territory dynamics, healthcare systems, Biogen therapies, patient landscape, treatments and HCPs/KMEs’ needs.
Manage territory, develop a strategic plan, and complete required number of calls with HCPs/KMEs.
Build and enhance relationships with HCPs/KMEs through well-developed call and engagement plans.
Develop and execute HCPs/KMEs engagement activities and events such as local peer-to-peer, explanatory meetings and other education programs in the Territory
Capture local scientific/medical intelligence to define, segment and profile HCPS/KMEs.
Inform HCPs/KMEs and other stakeholders regarding access and reimbursement programs (as appropriate in the Territory).
Partner with Biogen cross-functional teams to develop the regional MS disease centers of excellence (e.g. developing work processes & communication streams) in development of Intrathecal (IT) treatment process, to ensure patients have access and troubleshoot any challenges.
Track progress of new patients starting treatment (as legally permitted and appropriate in the Territory).
Seek out and participate in external opportunities for learning, including conferences, seminars, and professional associations.
Complete and maintain timely documentation (e.g. expense reports, compliance related).
Understand and adhere to all local and global compliance standards, including adverse event reporting, patient privacy, external stakeholder engagement etc.
Qualifications
Education requirements: Bachelors Degree in Pharmacy/ Biotech/Medicine required
Driving License: holding valid local driver’s license
A minimum of 2 years experience in specialty care/ neuroscience/ MS in the Biotech/Pharmaceutical industry or in a similar role with at least one year of local experience.
Good Planning and Organizing skills
Good at seeing things through to completion, also within a matrix organization
Sets high ethical standards and complies with the Biogen values and guidelines
Fluent language skills in Arabic as well as English (writing, speaking, reading)
Additional Information

Why Biogen?

Our mission to find therapies for neurological and rare diseases is a unique focus within our industry and this shared purpose is what connects us as a team. We work together to overcome obstacles and to follow the science. We are resilient as we strive to make an impact on our patients’ lives and on changing the course of medicine. Together, we pioneer. Together, we thrive.

We are seeking a highly motivated and organized individual to join our team as a Campus Event Organizer. In this role, you will be responsible for collaborating with university clubs and organizations to plan, promote and execute events on various university campuses.

Responsibilities

Collaborate with university clubs and organizations to identify event ideas and opportunities
Plan and organize events, including logistics, marketing and budget management
Coordinate with campus facilities and services to secure event venues and equipment
Promote events through various channels, including social media and traditional marketing techniques
Oversee the execution of events, including setup, on-site management and breakdown
Evaluate event success and provide feedback to university clubs and organizations

Qualifications
Strong organizational and project management skills
Experience planning and executing events
Excellent communication and collaboration skills
Strong attention to detail and ability to multitask
Ability to work independently and as part of a team
Passion for event planning and interest in university campus life

If you are a highly organized and motivated individual with a passion for event planning, we encourage you to apply today!
Drop your CV: hrd.orelco@gmail.com

Position based out of Gulshan 1, Dhaka Bangladesh
Department : Finance & Accounts
Reports to (position title): CEO
Company Description
Drinkwell (www.drinkwell.com) is an award-winning water technology company backed by TPG Growth and the Rise Fund, Danone Communities, Global Innovation Fund and Unilever providing safe drinking water solutions by blending novel water filtration technology with a franchise business model. Our systems-based approach to solving the water crisis involves three steps: (1) we evaluate and design water filtration systems in partnership with Utilities (e.g., Dhaka WASA, Chattogram WASA, Rajshahi City Corporation), NGOs (e.g., BRAC, Tata Trusts, Clinton Health Access Initiative), and Development Banks (e.g., World Bank) who have the social capital to provide safe drinking water in their communities; (2) build low-cost, high-efficiency water filtration systems entrepreneurs then operate as small businesses; (3) we service the systems by providing critical support around operation and maintenance, payments and quality assurance to ensure long-term success. Our work has been featured by The Economist, BBC, Forbes, Bloomberg, and other renowned media outlets.
Key responsibilities and accountabilities
Create and maintain financial models inclusive of actual and forecasted P&L, Balance Sheet, and Cash Flow Statement.
Lead, direct, and control the organization’s financial resources to maintain and control the short and long-term financial health of the business (profitability, cash delivery)
Together with the CEO - lead the strategic planning and decision-making processes to develop and implement an organization-wide business and financial strategy/models that aligns with the organization’s vision and long-term business objectives (incl. preparation, definition and execution of the Strategic Plan and business plan for Drinkwell System (incl. revisions and gaps)
Review and improve internal control systems so that financial transactions, policies, and procedures meet the organization’s short and long-term business objectives and are conducted in accordance with local & company regulations, accounting principles, and standards. Activities may include: accounting; credit control; cash flow; investment management; tax; insurance; treasury; internal audit; budgeting and forecasting; and foreign exchange; contracts; licences.
Responsible for financial budgeting & forecasting by preparing and maintaining the Basic Costing & Budgeting heads for Drinkwell.
Manage and monitor Investments/Capex to drive growth as well as the costs of investments.
Establish and maintain positive relationships with banks, regulatory authorities and other stakeholders to ensure the business financial needs.
Create board report materials on a quarterly basis, as well as monthly business review materials by working with finance and operations personnel
Lead capital increase process as per direction of CEO.
Prepare & monitor yearly accounts, balance sheet, documentation and cooperation with lawyer for tax settlement.
Visit the field/projects/affiliated concerns and follow up through reports on all relevant transactions.
Responsible for supervising records of the daily transaction for head office along with sites.
Checking and verification of bank vouchers, transactions, and reconciliation with making sure that all procedures completed.

Academic & other requirements
At least 8+ years working experience out of which 2+ years at managerial position. Experience with Quickbooks Online a plus.
MBA or Master’s degree in relative majors (Finance and/or accounting).
Ability to lead the transformation of a fast-growing organization by developing people.
Ability to keep a helicopter view as well as going in depth into business/accounting issues and challenges.
Experience in start-ups and fundraising is a plus.

name_location:
Operations & Customer Support (Senior) ManagerJob Location
Anywhere in BangladeshPublished On
21 Jan 2023
Company Information
A Well-Reputed Software Development Company
job_description:
Job Context
We are a leading & well-reputed software development company working more than a decade in Credit & Savings Management application development, Accounting & Inventory Management software etc. Our clients are spreaded all over the country. There is demand of our existing software product; and potential demand of few more complementary products is also huge in the country. We are constantly upgrading our existing software application to make it more user-friendly and are also exploring to increase more products & services in our portfolio of businesses.
It is a focal position where an incumbent will work with clients, software development team, junior staffs under your supervision, peer group people and Top Management. You need to be proactive and self-motivated to get things done without having much supervision.
It is a Mid-level position within the operations division, which will require peoples` management skill (including verbal & written communication skill, leadership skill etc.), technical knowledge on how a software firm works, basic understanding of software development process, gross understanding on database management system, software languages, web development tools & tips, basic ideas on webpage development technology etc.
You will also require to monitor & evaluate existing online and social media presence of the company & its existing products and find ways to improve promotional efforts, market presence & marketing. You are expected to have skill to write contents on products & services of the company for web, Facebook & other social media pages, produce creative contents including banners, festoon, promotional videos etc.
We expect you to bring in necessary experience & skill in order to introduce and implement new approach, process, discipline within operations, customers support and development teams; which will ultimately improve existing productivity, efficiency in product development and customer support of the company. So, you are expected to be a strong leader with a focused & disciplined approach in your work.
Based on your capacity and performance, this position may lead to higher management position within the organization.Job Responsibilities
You will be required to quickly learn day-to-day operational tools, practices & technical features of existing product & service, and implement existing tools & procedure to continue running existing operations.
You will be assigned with a portfolio of existing and potential clients to deal with their day-to-day operational issues, receive their phone calls and provide solution after having discussion with the Software team.
Take responsibility for the establishment and development of customer relationship, customer resource management.
Take responsibility for monitoring and managing key software development project by liaison with software development team, operations team and Top Management.
Be responsible for expanding and maintaining medium and long-term partnerships with local customers, ensuring the achievement of goals, exploring and cultivating new customer groups and new product opportunities.
Establish and optimize sales organization and sales team, clarify responsibilities and promote implementation.
Time to time, there are issues and bugs in the software system which need to be explored and resolved by the Software Team. In order to fix bugs you have to have clear understanding of the business logics and operational procedure of the existing software system. You will guide product team or software team about the issues and ensure the issues were resolved before making it live for the client.
Client will call your phone number when they face an issue with the software application - you need to answer to his queries modestly and get a solution (fix issue) within promised deadline by engaging the software & operations team members.
After getting a new product or feature development requirement from the client, you will be required to design the outline, process-flow, flow-chart etc. and discuss the same with the Software Development Team & Top Management to develop & implement the requirement in the application.
Upgrade, develop, introduce new tools & system to improve internal processes, administration, follow-up, performance appraisal to increase qualitative & quantitative improvement within the organization.
Make online & offline presentation to boost sales to the potential new clients. Time to time, you will provide training on various topics related to software system to the clients. You will visit clients' office, meet Top management & field level staffs to discuss issues, being faced by them and get those issues resolved by Software Team and other members of the Operations Team within limited deadline.
Explore and monitor other competitive products, services and vendors and suggest & implement ways of improvement in the existing product.
To lead and manage the team to ensure best output at all time.
Bring sustainable efficiency improvement by identifying the bottlenecks and ensuring elimination of it.
Actively explore to introduce new & innovative complementary products to increase portfolio of business.
Take lead to find loopholes in the existing product, process and actively engage with your teammates to complete the job within limited timeline.
Identify and report new and changing customer requirement on products and services.
Provide KPI progress information on a weekly basis.Educational Requirements
Graduation / Masters in CSE/Business/Commerce/Marketing/ Finance/Accounting OR, combination of Science (SSC+HSC) + Commerce (Graduation + Masters') only.Experience Requirements
At least 7 year(s)Additional Requirements
At least 07 (seven) years' of relevant work experience.
Skills required: Creative Thinking, Quick Problem Solving, Strong Analytical ability, Strong Negotiation skills.
Working Experience with a software development company and having experience of actively developing financial or accounting related software.
Ability to meet challenging deadlines and work in a fast-paced environment.
